qas.question: How many finalists were there on the first season of American Idol?
What is the name of the round that gives failed contestants another chance?
How were the semi-finalists split up to perform in season one?
How were the semi-finalists split up to perform in seasons two and three?
When did the wildcard round become a factor?
How many finalists were chosen for season one?
How many finalists made it to the finals for seasons two and three?

context: In the first three seasons, the semi-finalists were split into different groups to perform individually in their respective night. In <a4_0>season one<a4_0/>, there were <a2_0>three groups of <a0_0><a5_0>ten<a5_0/><a2_0/><a0_0/>, with the top three contestants from each group making the finals. In seasons two and three, there were <a3_0>four groups of eight<a3_0/>, and the top two of each selected. These seasons also featured a <a1_0>wildcard<a1_0/> round, where contestants who failed to qualify were given another chance. In season one, only one wildcard contestant was chosen by the judges, giving a total of ten finalists. In seasons two and three, each of the three judges championed one contestant with the public advancing a fourth into the finals, making <a6_0>12<a6_0/> finalists in all.
